title: Twitter bird logo replaced by an 'X' as early as Monday
description: Elon Musk annouced it on Sunday, after tweeting last October that 'buying Twitter is an accelerant to creating X, the everything app.'

title: The troubled story of Ukrainian Afghanistan veterans
description: In Odesa, as in the rest of Ukraine, monuments continue to commemorate the soldiers killed from 1979 to 1989 during the Soviet occupation of Afghanistan.

title: Greece: Thousands of tourists flee blazing wildfires on Rhodes
description: Greece has been battered by an extended spell of extreme heat and fires have burned for nearly a week on the island.

title: 'Barbenheimer' conquered North American box offices, as expected, in 'historic weekend'
description: Raking in a stunning $155 million, 'Barbie' scored the biggest opening weekend of any film this year – and the biggest ever for a female director.

title: Tour de France: Vingegaard emphatically wins his second successive Tour
description: The Danish cyclist cruised down the Champs Élysée on Sunday to claim his second Tour triumph.

title: Ultranationalist Russian blogger Strelkov arrested over criticism of the army
description: Former separatist commander Igor Guirkine, aka 'Strelkov,' has become a virulent voice against Moscow's hierarchy, both military and political. He is now being prosecuted for 'extremism.' It's a clear message to all critical voices, including nationalists.

title: The Hungarian government dreams of gentrifying Budapest's tourism industry
description: Attracted by low prices, partygoers from all over Europe have been flocking to the Hungarian capital and driving out the middle classes. But Prime Minister Viktor Orban's family is multiplying real estate projects to attract high-end tourism.

title: Spain votes in snap election with right favored to win
description: Voters are to decide on whether to hand Socialist Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez a new four-year mandate or, as polls suggest, bring the right back to power with its far-right ally.

title: Cuban novelist Zoé Valdès running for Spanish Senate under far-right Vox banner
description: The writer claims that she wants to prevent Spain from meeting the same fate as Cuba. A candidate in the Madrid constituency for the July 23 parliamentary elections, she has little chance of being elected.

title: French swimmer  Marchand obliterates Phelps' world record
description: Léon Marchand came in more than a second faster than Michael Phelps' fastest time in the 400 individual medley at the swimming world championships in Japan on Sunday.

title: Women's World Cup: Jamaica holds France to shock 0-0 draw in their opening game
description: The unanticipated draw on Sunday means Jamaica picks up its first ever point in the tournament.

title: A tiny mammal hunted herbivorous dinosaurs 125 million years ago in China
description: In a fossil deposit dubbed the 'Chinese Pompeii of dinosaurs,' a fight to death was forever frozen in time by a volcanic mudslide.

title: Climate crisis: 'Warming is right in line with early predictions. But many of the impacts are exceeding predictions'
description: For climatologist Michael E. Mann, the extreme phenomena affecting the planet are not the result of a sudden acceleration in global warming. But, he warns, without strong action, a runaway effect cannot be ruled out.

title: Death toll rises after torrential rain causes flash flooding in Afghanistan
description: At least 26 people have been confirmed dead and more than 40 still missing in central Afghanistan, with 31 killed nationwide since Friday.

title: Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez wets his shirt: Does anyone care?
description: On July 16, the Socialist leader galvanized his activists on a hot night in Barcelona ahead of Sunday's legislative elections.

title: Gordon Brown: 'The Spanish Conservatives' capitulation to the far right would reverberate across the continent'
description: The former British Prime Minister deplores the Spanish People's Party's plan to ally itself with Vox and its hyper-nationalist, anti-LGBT and anti-immigration program in the event of victory.

title: Russian strikes on Odesa kill at least one, 'destroy' UNESCO-listed cathedral
description: Four children were among the 20 people wounded in the latest strikes on Odesa as Moscow increases attacks on critical port infrastructure since the cancelation of the grain deal.

title: Women's World Cup: Les Bleues are eager for battle ahead of opening match against Jamaica
description: The French team coached by Hervé Renard begins its tournament in Sydney at noon Paris time on Sunday. They will be without defender Elisa De Almeida, who has a calf injury.

title: Hervé Renard: 'I'm fully committed to the women's football cause'
description: Ahead of the French women's team's World Cup debut in Australia on Sunday, the coach talked to Le Monde about his surprise appointment and his desire to help grow the sport.

title: Spain: With Vox, the far right takes center stage in the early parliamentary elections
description: The party, close to Hungary's Orban's ideas, could allow the conservative People's Party to form a majority after the elections on Sunday.

title: Russians who refused to fight in Ukraine are eligible for political asylum in France
description: France's National Asylum Court clarified its case law on Russian deserters and draft dodgers, pointing out that the applicant must 'provide evidence that he or she has actually been called up to serve in the armed forces.'
